%pyspark

Imports and versioning.

Update processor_version as necessary

import re

from pyspark import SparkContext, SparkConf

%pyspark

"""
Load geonames from ScyllaDB (TODO: Load from csv? Load from redis?)
"""
geocode_rdd = sqlContext.read.format("org.apache.spark.sql.cassandra").options(table="geocode", keyspace="geonames").load().cache()
geocode_pdd =  geocode_rdd.toPandas()
geocode_pdd['name'] = geocode_pdd['name'].str.lower()
sqlContext.registerDataFrameAsTable(geocode_rdd, "geonames")

%pyspark

"""
Global variables
"""

SCRIPT_DIR = os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__))
CODE_REGEX = r'(?:\s|^|!|,|\()([A-Z]{2,3})(?:\s|$|!|,|\))'
DELETE_REGEX = r'\\n|\\t|\>|\<|\(|\)|\>|\<'

# Words that should not be considered placenames
IGNORE_WORDS = ['a','ai','I','of','the''many','may','march','center','as','see','valley','university','about','new','sars','aids','hpv','adhd','newcastle','elisa','to','influenza','who','pro','os','and','pdt','in','flu','ha','ron','control','mod','northern','southern','eastern','western','all','am','pm','eua','avian','ah','human','date','health','fry','many','is','the','by','on','ap','er','church',
]

%pyspark

"""
Stanford Tagger Functions
TODO: Need jar loaded in pyspark, training data jar available in path
Not currently being used
"""

def get_stanford_tagger():
    """
    Use the superior Stanford tagger
    """
    training_db = os.path.join(
        SCRIPT_DIR,
        'resources/classifiers/english.conll.4class.distsim.crf.ser.gz')
    jar_file = os.path.join(SCRIPT_DIR, 'resources/stanford-ner.jar')
    tagger = nltk.StanfordNERTagger(training_db, path_to_jar=jar_file)
    return tagger

def get_stanford_gpes(text):
    """
    Return a list of possible names based on Stanford NLTK chunking
    """
    tokens = [x.strip('.') for x in nltk.word_tokenize(text)]
    tagger = get_stanford_tagger()
    stagged_text = tagger.tag(tokens)
    ne_tree = stanford2tree(stagged_text)
    ne_in_sent = []
    for subtree in ne_tree:
        if type(
                subtree) == nltk.Tree:  # If subtree is a noun chunk, i.e. NE != "O"
            ne_label = subtree.label()
            ne_string = " ".join([token for token, pos in subtree.leaves()])
            if ne_label in ['ORGANIZATION', 'LOCATION']:
                ne_in_sent.append(ne_string)
    return ne_in_sent


def stanfordNE2BIO(tagged_sent):
    bio_tagged_sent = []
    prev_tag = "O"
    for token, tag in tagged_sent:
        if tag == "O":  # O
            prev_tag = tag
            continue
        if tag != "O" and prev_tag == "O":  # Begin NE
            bio_tagged_sent.append((token, "B-" + tag))
            prev_tag = tag
        elif prev_tag != "O" and prev_tag == tag:  # Inside NE
            bio_tagged_sent.append((token, "I-" + tag))
            prev_tag = tag
        elif prev_tag != "O" and prev_tag != tag:  # Adjacent NE
            bio_tagged_sent.append((token, "B-" + tag))
            prev_tag = tag

    return bio_tagged_sent


def stanford2tree(ne_tagged_sent):
    bio_tagged_sent = stanfordNE2BIO(ne_tagged_sent)
    bio_tagged_filtered = [x for x in bio_tagged_sent if x[0]]
    if bio_tagged_filtered:
        sent_tokens, sent_ne_tags = zip(*bio_tagged_filtered)
        pos_tokens = nltk.pos_tag(sent_tokens)
        sent_pos_tags = [pos for token, pos in pos_tokens]
        sent_conlltags = [(token, pos, ne) for token, pos, ne in
                          zip(sent_tokens, sent_pos_tags, sent_ne_tags)]
        ne_tree = nltk.conlltags2tree(sent_conlltags)
        return ne_tree
    else:
        return []

%pyspark

def name_match(name, results, admin1=None, country=None):
    """
    Create a list of objects for each match found for a name
    """
    name_matches = []
    for geoname in results:
        if not admin1 or admin1 == geoname['admin1_code']:
            if not country or country == geoname["country_code"]:
                name_matches.append({
                    'coord': [[geoname['longitude'], geoname['latitude']]],
                    'geonameid': geoname['geonameid'],
                    'name': geoname['name'],
                    'matching_word': name,
                    'alternate': geoname['alternatenames'],
                    'admin1': geoname['admin1_code'],
                    'admin2': geoname['admin2_code'],
                    'admin3': geoname['admin3_code'],
                    'admin4': geoname['admin4_code'],
                    'feature_code': geoname['feature_code'],
                    'country': geoname['country_code'],
                    'population': geoname.get('population') or 0,
                    'score': -1
                })
    return name_matches

%pyspark
res = extract("I want to live in Colorado someday ")
print(res)

%pyspark
"""
Load processed_news.news table into SparkRDD
"""
hm_news = sqlContext.read.format("org.apache.spark.sql.cassandra").options(table="news", keyspace="processed_news").load().cache()

%pyspark

"""
Select news records which have a place_name
"""

sub_hm_news = hm_news.filter(hm_news["place_name"].isNotNull()).cache()
sub_hm_news.select('place_list', 'place_name', 't', 'ds').show(5)

%pyspark

"""
UDF Functions for a) extract and geocode, b) geocode only
"""

from pyspark.sql.types import StringType, StructType, FloatType, DoubleType, IntegerType, StructField, ArrayType
from pyspark.sql.functions import udf

PlaceType =  ArrayType(StructType([
    StructField('place_name', StringType(), True),
    StructField('place_lat', FloatType(), True),    
    StructField('place_lng', FloatType(), True),  
    StructField('place_id', IntegerType(), True),
    StructField('geo_geonameid', IntegerType(), True)
    ]),True)

extract_udf = udf(lambda txt: extract(txt), PlaceType)
geocode_udf = udf(lambda txt: geocode(txt), PlaceType)

%pyspark

"""
Calculate version column for this week
"""
import datetime

def versiondate_column(column, version, dt):
    return '{}__{}__{}'.format(column,
                               version.replace('.', '_'),
                               datetime.datetime.strftime(dt, '%Y%W'))

%pyspark
"""
Geocode rows with existing place_name column
"""
news_placelist = sub_hm_news.withColumn("place_list", geocode_udf(sub_hm_news["place_name"])).cache()

Create versioning columns and populate them
"""

vdc = versiondate_column(processor_name, processor_version, today)
v = '{}_v'.format(processor_name)
news_latlng = news_latlng.withColumn(v, lit(processor_version)).withColumn(vdc, news_latlng['place_list'])

%pyspark

"""
Now select all rows with null/empty place_name values and non-null t values (if any)
"""
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, when, size

def blank_as_null(x):
    return when(col(x) != "", col(x)).otherwise(None)

sub_news_noname = hm_news.withColumn("place_name", blank_as_null("place_name"))
sub_news_noname = sub_news_noname.filter((sub_news_noname["place_name"].isNull()) & (sub_news_noname["t"].isNotNull())).cache()
sub_news_noname.select('place_list', 'place_name', 't').show(5)

%pyspark

"""
Extract and geocode rows without place_name values based on 't' column
"""

noname_placelist = sub_news_noname.withColumn("place_list", extract_udf(sub_news_noname["t"])).cache()

%pyspark

noname_placelist.select('place_list','t').show(10)

%pyspark

"""
Assign extract/geocode results to  "place_lat", "place_lng" columns, based on 1st element of place_list
"""

from pyspark.sql.functions import lit

noname_latlng = noname_placelist.filter(noname_placelist["place_list"].isNotNull()).withColumn("place_lat", noname_placelist["place_list"][0].place_lat).withColumn("place_lng", noname_placelist["place_list"][0].place_lng).news_latlng.withColumn(v, lit(processor_version)).withColumn(vdc, news_latlng['place_list'])

%pyspark

noname_latlng.select("id", "ds", "ymds", "rdt", "place_list", "place_lat", "place_lng", v, vdc).show(10)

%pyspark

"""
Save results to Scylla
"""

noname_latlng.select("id", "ds", "ymds", "rdt", "place_list", "place_lat", "place_lng", v, vdc).write.format("org.apache.spark.sql.cassandra").options(table="news", keyspace="processed_news").save(mode="append")
